I will reveal what this topic ultimately leads to after a week since I 
started this topic.

Meanwhile, I generally dislike using skeletons in scenarios because 
they are hard to control.  I mean if I have multiple enemy teams the 
skeletons will invariably end up running into other teams before 
taking on the player.  The only reason I put doors in 'The Brag' was 
to achieve the effect of taking on a few opponents at a time.  This 
leads to another point:  I do not like to face millions of opponents 
all at once and then go chasing after the remaining few remaining.  
That is what makes 'Tic and Tac' scenario so hard:  The crushing 
number of opponents all at once.

That is what I think succeeded in preventing with 'Archer Encampment' 
from my own scenarios:  1 army to get you distracted while 4 other 
armies are approaching.

In general, in a good scenario, you do not fight half your opponents 
all at once.
